page.title: 14PETS KEPT IN PONTESBURY
page.content: We surveyed 22 houses in Pontesbury to find out what kind of pets people keep. Most of the people owned cats and dogs but one lady had an albino rat. Most people bought pedigree dogs from a specialist breeder, but cats came from pet shops. One Burmese cat had been bought from a breeder in London. Everyone valued their pets' company and talked to them a lot. All the pets were tame and playful except for two 'oldies'. The pets were kept inside the house, except for one dog who lived in an outside kennel. Most of the dogs were fed on biscuit meal and tinned dog meat. A Staffordshire bull terrier was fed on raw meat from the butcher. Cats were fed on tinned meat,with some table scraps. Dogs were brushed and shampooed regularly and exercised daily.
